direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve removing elements from the queue, though removeAll removes a collection of elements while remove removes a single element.
Both methods modify the queue by removing elements, but retainAll retains only the elements in the specified collection.
Both methods clear elements from the queue, though clear removes all elements while removeAll removes a specified collection.
Both methods involve removing elements based on a condition, though removeIf uses a predicate while removeAll uses a collection.

enhanced_by.reason: The unmodifiableQueue method initializes the queue that removeAll operates on.
The iterator method is often used to traverse the queue before or after removeAll operations.
The size method can be used to verify the state of the queue after removeAll operations.
